goalOnboarding.title: Savings Goals
goalOnboarding.howItWorksDescription: Savings goals work as a separate fund. You define how much you want to save and each time you set aside money, you record it as an expense in that category. This way it leaves your balance but accumulates in your goal.
goalOnboarding.exampleText:
Goal: Save $500,000 for vacation
Today you set aside $50,000 ‚Üí You record it as an expense in "Vacation"
Your progress: $50,000 saved / $500,000 (10%)
goalOnboarding.recommendationText: Create a category with your goal's name (e.g., "Vacation", "Emergency Fund", "New Motorcycle"). Each time you set aside money, record it as an expense in that category.

modal.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this budget?
modal.errorDuplicate: An active budget already exists for this category in the selected period.

screen1.title: Organize your money with Plans
screen1.subtitle: Create spending limits and savings goals to control your finances intelligently.
screen1.limitsDescription: Set a spending cap for specific categories and keep your expenses under control.
screen1.goalsDescription: Set savings targets and track your progress in real-time.
screen1.trackingDescription: Automatic alerts, daily suggestions, and completed results analysis.

screen2.title: Two Types of Plans
screen2.subtitle: Choose between controlling your spending or saving for your goals.
screen2.limitInfo: Set a maximum spending cap for a category. Perfect for controlling variable expenses like groceries, restaurants, or entertainment.
screen2.goalInfo: Set a savings target for categories like investments, emergency fund, or a special project.

screen3.title: Review Your History
screen3.subtitle: Filter between your active and completed plans to analyze results.
screen3.infoDescription: When a plan ends, a complete summary is shown: whether you met the goal, stayed within the limit, or how much you exceeded.

screen4.title: Smart Alerts
screen4.subtitle: Receive automatic notifications about the status of your plans.
